column4: thanks for reply.. i just get confused over the whole mode numbers thing.. let me check it out
flux so you want ugo User to read write execute , group read write Execute , other execute
i think my file permissions are opposite.. the .ssh directory is rwx for user (so 700 i guess) and id_rsa is rw for user (so 600)..
yes I PMed you that after I hit enter on that
another question is this id_rsa file encrypted?
cause it looks like anyone using my pc can just copy it off
you can control who get ssh with the /etc/ssh/sshd_config
install firestarter firewall and portsentry on the portsentry set attempt to 2
it will block failed attempts and auto add them to your deny list

ok thanks for reply.. am doing what you suggested...but i think what you are talking about is ssh-agent (not sure)... my question is id_rsa (which stores the private key, i think) encrypted.. because otherwise it is a bit like a password file stored in plain text
you can change your jey just generate a new one
